table_caption: Comparisons between dementia groups and healthy controls
table_foot: bvFTD participants showed severe deficits, most frequently detected as decreases in FA (↓) (FDR critical P = 0.024), increases in MD (↑) (FDR critical P = 0.035), RD (FDR critical P = 0.034) and AX (FDR critical P = 0.019). Most affected tracts in bvFTD were the L-UNC, R-UNC, CC-FNR, L-ATR, R-ATR, L-CGC, R-CGC and L-SLF (Fig. 2). EOAD participants showed significant decreases in FA (FDR critical P = 1.5 × 10−3), increases in MD (FDR critical P = 0.01), RD (FDR critical P = 9.2 × 10−3) and AX (FDR critical P = 5.2 × 10−3). The L-PHC, R-PHC and CC-PAR stood out as most affected (Fig. 3). The percentage of tracts that passed FDR threshold is listed and total effect size (r) computed across each fiber
